meanings.sent1: The car accident was a terrible misevent.
meanings.sent2: The sudden storm was a shocking misevent.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake falling on the floor was a small misevent.
meanings.sent4: Losing the final game felt like a huge misevent.
meanings.sent5: The power outage during the party was a memorable misevent.

meanings.definition: To experience an unfortunate event or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to never misevent such a tragedy again.
meanings.sent2: They fear they will misevent another financial crisis.
meanings.sent3: He tends to misevent minor mishaps into major disasters.
meanings.sent4: Miseventing setbacks can lead to valuable life lessons.
meanings.sent5: Trying to avoid miseventing is a common human struggle.
